statements.name: PROC DATAMETRICS
statements.description: Apply data profiling analysis to a data set.

arguments.name: FORMAT
arguments.description: Formatted values are used for profiling if present.

arguments.name: FREQUENCIES=
arguments.description: the maximum number of frequency values to publish in the output. The range is 0-2,147,483,647.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Calculates the median if present. This is optional because the median calculation requires more resources.

arguments.name: MINMAX=
arguments.description: The maximum number of min/max values to publish in the output. The range is 0-2,147,483,647.

arguments.name: THREADS=
arguments.description: The number of threads to be used in computing the results. The range is 0â€“32,768.

statements.name: IDENTITIES
statements.description: Performs identification anaylsis on character data if present.

arguments.name: DEFINITION=
arguments.description: The name of the QKB identification analysis definition to use in the specified QKB locale for identification analysis. See .

arguments.name: LOCALE=
arguments.description: The ISO code name of the QKB locale to use for the specified identification analysis definition to use for identification analysis. See QKB Locale ISO Codes on the SAS support website.

arguments.name: MULTIIDENTITY
arguments.description: Calculates more than one identity for identification analysis. The QKB can sometimes return more than one identity for a given value, and each one can have a different score. The returned value is a delimited list of scores for each identity that is supported by the identification-analysis-definition.

arguments.name: QKB=
arguments.description: The fully qualified path of the root directory of the Quality Knowledge Base to use for identification analysis for more information. See .

statements.name: VARIABLES
statements.description: A space-separated list of variables to profile.

arguments.name: profile-variable
arguments.description: If the VARIABLES statement is specified, then one or more variables of profile is required.
